1625220.name: Half-Life: Element 64
1625220.description:
Welcome back to 1998! While CRT monitors, floopy disks and GSM cell phones are still hot, the world has to face an alien threat from dimension unknown. Black Mesa Research Facility is breached and only one man can save the human race from extinction. Step up to the task, load your shotgun and save the universe in this adventure inspired by classic first-person shooters of 1990s!

Element 64 is a mod set in the award-winning world of Half-Life. Experience the revamped gameplay inspired by retro shooters of mid-1990s, in a funky twist on this iconic universe from Valve Software. 

Battle the zombified personnel, military contractors and alien invaders across four distinct chapters of the game, each featuring unique themes, enemies and bosses. Conquer the maps and uncover secrets in a truly oldschool fashion, with a set of weapons familiar to those who ventured the hallways of Black Mesa in the past.

It's do or die!

Quantum Entanglement

Lunch areas, medical bays, security rooms and research facilities are now infested with rogue officers, zombified personnel and alien invaders. Conquer the not-so-sterile corridors in first chapter of the journey to save the world from the brink

Out of Service

Maintenance tunnels, freight elevators and storage facilities have been under deep occupation from alien invaders and their earthly thralls. Venture into the seedy, dark underbelly of Black Mesa to uncover the source of the gnarly infestation in second chapter of the game

Further Transmission

Bunkers, Military Outposts and Airfields are at the center of battle brought to Black Mesa by the ruthless HECU Soldiers and Black Ops operatives. Declare the war on entire armies in this intense, surface flavoured chapter of Element 64

Temporal Matter

Fourth chapter brings the chaotic, high-stakes gameplay set in the most secretive and protected labs which are now overflowing with all varieties of alien monstrosities, military contractors and deadly traps. Make no mistake, only the most skillful MIT graduates will survive this!

Notice

Half-Life: Element 64 is a fan-made modification for Half-Life. Dark Vector is not associated with Valve in any way.
